description: Scope domain concepts correctly - place at the most specific level where relevant and ensure they represent complete functional capabilities. Use 'local' scope for single sub-epic concepts, 'global' for shared concepts. Concepts should be complete functional units, not fragments.

do.description: Place concepts at correct scope level and ensure functional completeness

guidance.description: Place concepts locally when they're only relevant to one sub-epic
example: Calculates modifier from score: Number, AbilityScore
Calculates remaining points: Number, AbilityScore, PointBuyLimit
Validates point distribution: Boolean, AbilityScore, PointBuyRules
(Only used within this sub-epic, so placed locally)

guidance.description: Elevate concepts to parent when shared across multiple sub-epics
example: Advances to next level: Character, ExperiencePoints, LevelRequirements
(Character shared by multiple sub-epics, so placed at epic level)

guidance.description: Define concepts that represent complete functional capabilities with all necessary responsibilities
example: Generates trades to achieve target: Trade, Portfolio, TargetAllocation
Compares current to target allocation: AllocationDifference, Portfolio, TargetAllocation
Explains rebalance rationale: Rationale, AllocationDifference, MarketConditions
Minimizes transaction costs: Money, Trade, TradingFees
(Complete: can produce recommendation with all supporting data and rationale)

guidance.description: Scope concepts to meaningful business capabilities that can accomplish something alone
example: Creates from shopping cart: Cart, Customer
Calculates subtotal from items: Money, LineItem
Calculates tax based on location: Money, LineItem, TaxRate, ShippingAddress
Calculates total with shipping: Money, LineItem, TaxRate, ShippingMethod
Validates inventory availability: Boolean, LineItem, InventoryService
(Complete: represents full order capability with validation and calculations)

dont.description: Don't place concepts at wrong scope level or create incomplete fragments

guidance.description: Don't place all concepts globally by default
example: Order, LineItem, ShippingAddress, BillingAddress, PaymentMethod, TaxCalculator, DiscountCalculator, ShippingCalculator (WRONG: all global)
(TaxCalculator, DiscountCalculator only used in 'Calculate Totals' sub-epic - should be local)

guidance.description: Don't keep concepts local when they're used by multiple sub-epics
example: Sub-Epic: Display Order (WRONG: also defines Order locally)
(Order duplicated - should be elevated to epic level)

guidance.description: Don't split concepts into fragments that can't accomplish anything alone
example: (Fragments - should be combined into Trade with complete responsibilities)

guidance.description: Don't create concepts that are just implementation details without functional purpose
example: (Should be part of Order: Order validates itself during creation)
